channel.title: [530] Farther draw distance
channel.description:
What I did:
- Updated draw distance to be around 16-32 tile radius. - Optimize batching for faster draw calls. - Optimized dynamic shadows a bit.
Still runs fairly slow with anti-aliasing, and at full screen but in most areas it's 50 FPS. Going to try and optimize it further for production.
Normally:

Updated:

[img]http://i.imgur.com/a0sIYtp.jpg[/img]
[img]http://i.imgur.com/vvcnnxu.jpg[/img]

item.title: [530] Farther draw distance
item.dc:creator: @_nova1 _nova
item.description:
@_nova1 wrote:

My life isn’t devoted to Thornefall. That’s an entirely different beast and a completely different role. I don’t work on the engine because I don’t know C++/my code in C++ wouldn’t be close to what we need in order to pass the pipeline. It’s nice to be free of the overhead of a review pipeline. I enjoy my graphics playground, its fun, and keeps my skills sharp.

Read full topic

item.title: [530] Farther draw distance
item.dc:creator: @_nova1 _nova
item.description:
@_nova1 wrote:

Because this easy enough to manage and I have a good testing platform (because fudge writing my own server for anything >600). Just loaded up the moparscape server, get to play around with the client. I can add in deferred shading on my own time if I want, and move the water shader to an actual fragment/vertex shader. I also want to implement HDR and bloom too. Eventually ™.

Ooo and skyboxes. They have a skybox material shader but its really funky because they didn’t expect many people to have SIX texture units (holy shit) let alone 3.

Read full topic

what if you just used the new client that does that already

Read full topic

item.title: [530] Farther draw distance
item.dc:creator: @_nova1 _nova
item.description:
@_nova1 wrote:

I think they were more worried about comparability. Shaders didn’t exist until GL2, and I don’t think deferred rendering was a staple until a bit later. They did have procedural textures in their 530 (shockingly) and that according to some research I did was NOT industry standard (is it even now?). So I guess they were ahead of the curve there.

It’s probably why a lot of their textures look so nice honestly. The high/low detail is actually enabled bump maps hahaha. I’m not sure where they store those tbh. Might be something I missed.

Read full topic

item.title: [530] Farther draw distance
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

Yeah it’s pretty ridiculous how poor the RS client does when it comes to their rendering.

Read full topic

item.title: [530] Farther draw distance
item.dc:creator: @_nova1 _nova
item.description:
@_nova1 wrote:

I could lie and say it wasn’t but the photos have my name. But people won’t catch on quickly. I completely erased all access I have to my old account, blank slate.

@David: No. You have to update the viewing frustrum so that the far distance doesn’t cull fragments beyond the 16 tile area your client renders around you, modify the length of the viewport, update the culling distance so that it doesn’t clip tiles (non-gl), and you have to modify the fog far depth. If you want exactly where those are I wouldn’t begrudge you but this is pretty experimental because of the way they do dynamic shadows you really fudge your frame rate. I need to optimize it more, and play around with what looks best.

530 isn’t a very optimized client OpenGL wise (especially with the technology we have in GL3-4). A lot of things can be done better and you can probably easily get 50 FPS after, especially on newer hardware.

There’s also an issue with the player updating only supporting showing players in your local 16x16 area. But my eventual plan is to completely redo the mobile updating protocols so that you can render people far outside that area (although you won’t be able to interact with them for balance purposes).

Also I want to add ‘render distance’ setting to the graphics interface, so that people on older hardware can’t access the game. That’d be unfortunate.

My client is completely renamed by the way (classes). I will eventually release it when I finalize some naming and fix some of the really nasty nested if-statements.

@The Thornefall comment: I’ve spent a few hours doing this so why not.

Read full topic
